title: West Elm's Space-Saving Furniture and Decor Is Up to 60% Off
description: Make your home look bigger and brighter with these picks. READ MORE...
author: Nikol Slatinska
excerpt: Make your home look bigger and brighter with these picks.
text: DecoratingMoneyNikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping WriterNikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping WriterI write home shopping content for Apartment Therapy. My job entails product testing and reviewing, as well as writing serviceable shopping guides for furniture and home decor. I received my undergraduate journalism degree at the University of Missouri and wrote for local publications in my college town. published yesterdayWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Even amid all of the Presidents’ Day sales going on at the moment, I’ve been holding out for a select few retailers to finally launch their deals. One of them is West Elm, whose own sale is now live, with discounts of up to 60% off across all product categories. I’ve tested my fair share of West Elm furniture and decor for AT’s Personal Shopper series, and I can confirm that the pieces are every bit as beautiful in person as they are in pictures, and they hold up well over time, too.In looking at the countless markdowns, I saw so many furniture and storage pieces that would make wonderful additions to small homes. You can see my top picks below, along with a couple of decor finds that’ll instantly transform your space for less. It can be hard to find such well-made furniture at a discount, so be sure to get all of your shopping done this holiday weekend and make your apartment look beautiful for the rest of the new year (and beyond).1 / 10West Elm$639.20was $799.00Not only did this curved sofa win a spot on our Design Awards list, but contributor Sarah also considers it to be the perfect style for her small living room. “The sofa features a chic, low-profile bat wing back that gently curves at its ends — a silhouette that feels minimalist but not too modern in style,” her review reads. “It complements my eclectic, vintage decor perfectly.” Snag the Mella on sale in either a stunning velvet or cozy bouclé fabric.2 / 10West Elm$399.20was $499.00Don’t underestimate the power of a good rug when it comes to making your space look bigger and tying all of your furniture together. The Ivy rug is great because its pattern is eye-catching but not too loud, so it adds visual interest without overwhelming the surrounding area. Score it for less in either a beige or mustard color, and delight in its soft but sturdy wool construction.3 / 10West Elm$399.20was $499.00A lot of West Elm’s nightstands are pretty wide, but this adorable rattan number easily fits between your bed and the wall, even if it’s only a sliver of space. The nightstand could also work as a side table for the living room — especially if you’d like to add a beachy or boho touch to dress up the space.4 / 10West Elm$615.20was $769.00One of the most obvious but foolproof ways to make a room look bigger is by adding mirrors, and this extra-wide pick is a fabulous option. It’s on sale in both wood frame finishes and can stand freely when propped against a wall. Additionally, the mirror’s arched top differentiates it from your basic rectangular silhouette.5 / 10West Elm$19.99was $29.00A steal at just $20, this drill-free wall shelf is a solid way to display all of your favorite photos and postcards. It boasts a simple ash wood design and adheres to the wall via double-sided adhesive strips, although these are not included in the purchase. Grab multiple ledges to create a sentimental gallery wall of sorts.6 / 10West Elm$559.20was $699.00Looking for a living room addition that immediately catches the eye and prompts visitors to ask where you found it? Then pick up the Drum storage coffee table. Two small ports on either side allow you to lift its top and reveal a hollow interior that's perfect for storing extra blankets, random mementos, or out-of-season decor. You can totally forego the bins and boxes and instead delight in a clutter-free space with this fashion-forward find.7 / 10West Elm$319.20was $399.00Take home this gravity-defying floor lamp for $80 off during the sale. It swoops beautifully over a chair or couch while providing warm light through the linen shade. The body is made of sturdy, durable metal, and there's an in-line on/off switch for your convenience.8 / 10West Elm$719.20was $899.00There’s so much you could do with this chic fluted bookshelf. Place it in the living room or home office, or maybe even in the bathroom for extra storage. Its open shelves keep everything from books to towels to jewelry boxes easily accessible, while the cabinet underneath effortlessly conceals clutter.9 / 10West Elm$639.20was $799.00The Harris collection is one of West Elm’s bestselling living room seating collections, and when you take a look at this chair’s clean lines and experience its plush cushions, you’ll understand why. It’s on sale in two velvet upholstery colors, as well as a gray chunky chenille that’ll seamlessly match the rest of your furniture and decor. Because the chair is so simple, it’s also incredibly versatile when it comes to styling.10 / 10West Elm$199.99was $299.00If you have a bathroom that’s not only small but also tight on storage space, consider this over-the-toilet shelf system. With a four-tier design, it provides ample space for towels, toiletries, and more. What’s more, the shelf is made from corrosive-proof glass and metal, so it won’t rust, warp, or crack from the moisture in your bathroom.
html:
• Decorating
  • Money

Nikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping Writer

Nikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping Writer

I write home shopping content for Apartment Therapy. My job entails product testing and reviewing, as well as writing serviceable shopping guides for furniture and home decor. I received my undergraduate journalism degree at the University of Missouri and wrote for local publications in my college town.

published yesterday

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Even amid all of the Presidents’ Day sales going on at the moment, I’ve been holding out for a select few retailers to finally launch their deals. One of them is West Elm, whose own sale is now live, with discounts of up to 60% off across all product categories. I’ve tested my fair share of West Elm furniture and decor for AT’s Personal Shopper series, and I can confirm that the pieces are every bit as beautiful in person as they are in pictures, and they hold up well over time, too.

In looking at the countless markdowns, I saw so many furniture and storage pieces that would make wonderful additions to small homes. You can see my top picks below, along with a couple of decor finds that’ll instantly transform your space for less. It can be hard to find such well-made furniture at a discount, so be sure to get all of your shopping done this holiday weekend and make your apartment look beautiful for the rest of the new year (and beyond).

1 / 10

West Elm

$639.20

was $799.00

Not only did this curved sofa win a spot on our Design Awards list, but contributor Sarah also considers it to be the perfect style for her small living room. “The sofa features a chic, low-profile bat wing back that gently curves at its ends — a silhouette that feels minimalist but not too modern in style,” her review reads. “It complements my eclectic, vintage decor perfectly.” Snag the Mella on sale in either a stunning velvet or cozy bouclé fabric.

2 / 10

West Elm

$399.20

was $499.00

Don’t underestimate the power of a good rug when it comes to making your space look bigger and tying all of your furniture together. The Ivy rug is great because its pattern is eye-catching but not too loud, so it adds visual interest without overwhelming the surrounding area. Score it for less in either a beige or mustard color, and delight in its soft but sturdy wool construction.

3 / 10

West Elm

$399.20

was $499.00

A lot of West Elm’s nightstands are pretty wide, but this adorable rattan number easily fits between your bed and the wall, even if it’s only a sliver of space. The nightstand could also work as a side table for the living room — especially if you’d like to add a beachy or boho touch to dress up the space.

4 / 10

West Elm

$615.20

was $769.00

One of the most obvious but foolproof ways to make a room look bigger is by adding mirrors, and this extra-wide pick is a fabulous option. It’s on sale in both wood frame finishes and can stand freely when propped against a wall. Additionally, the mirror’s arched top differentiates it from your basic rectangular silhouette.

5 / 10

West Elm

$19.99

was $29.00

A steal at just $20, this drill-free wall shelf is a solid way to display all of your favorite photos and postcards. It boasts a simple ash wood design and adheres to the wall via double-sided adhesive strips, although these are not included in the purchase. Grab multiple ledges to create a sentimental gallery wall of sorts.

6 / 10

West Elm

$559.20

was $699.00

Looking for a living room addition that immediately catches the eye and prompts visitors to ask where you found it? Then pick up the Drum storage coffee table. Two small ports on either side allow you to lift its top and reveal a hollow interior that's perfect for storing extra blankets, random mementos, or out-of-season decor. You can totally forego the bins and boxes and instead delight in a clutter-free space with this fashion-forward find.

7 / 10

West Elm

$319.20

was $399.00

Take home this gravity-defying floor lamp for $80 off during the sale. It swoops beautifully over a chair or couch while providing warm light through the linen shade. The body is made of sturdy, durable metal, and there's an in-line on/off switch for your convenience.

8 / 10

West Elm

$719.20

was $899.00

There’s so much you could do with this chic fluted bookshelf. Place it in the living room or home office, or maybe even in the bathroom for extra storage. Its open shelves keep everything from books to towels to jewelry boxes easily accessible, while the cabinet underneath effortlessly conceals clutter.

9 / 10

West Elm

$639.20

was $799.00

The Harris collection is one of West Elm’s bestselling living room seating collections, and when you take a look at this chair’s clean lines and experience its plush cushions, you’ll understand why. It’s on sale in two velvet upholstery colors, as well as a gray chunky chenille that’ll seamlessly match the rest of your furniture and decor. Because the chair is so simple, it’s also incredibly versatile when it comes to styling.

10 / 10

West Elm

$199.99

was $299.00

If you have a bathroom that’s not only small but also tight on storage space, consider this over-the-toilet shelf system. With a four-tier design, it provides ample space for towels, toiletries, and more. What’s more, the shelf is made from corrosive-proof glass and metal, so it won’t rust, warp, or crack from the moisture in your bathroom.
